page.syntax: Result_String as C = UI_GET_RADIO(C title,C default_choice,C choice1[,C choice 2,...])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: default_choice
argument.description: Determines which radio button is selected when the dialog box first appears. This parameter is a numeric value indicating which choice (from 1 to 8) is to be selected. For example, if the Default Number is 2, the second radio button is selected when the dialog box appears.

argument.name: choice1
argument.description: The label for the first radio button.

argument.name: choice
argument.description: Optional. Labels for up to seven additional radio buttons.

page.description: Prompt user for selection from radio button.
page.discussion: UI_GET_RADIO() creates and displays a dialog box containing between 1 and 8 radio buttons. Your response is returned as a Result_String that contains the text of the button that you chose when you clicked the dialog box's OK button. This function is useful for obtaining an answer to a multiple choice condition.
